original_title: Sri Lanka Litro keeps LPG price unchanged, praises its imports at lower price
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Prices of cooking gas distributed by Sri Lanka’s state run Litro Gas will be unchanged this month despite a price hike in the global market as the company has bought stocks when the price of domestic liquefied petroleum (LP) gas was low, the company said on Friday.

Litro Gas Chairman Muditha Peiris in a statement said the company bought LPG stock when the global prices were low and it does not have to raise the price this month in line with the increase of international price hike.
Litro has reduced the prices in the last four months in a row through July.
Last month, it revised down the mostly used 12.5 kg cylinder price by Rs. 204 rupees to Rs. 2,892, reducing the price by 1,761 rupees in total during the last 4 months.
